greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle A000012(signed) * A103451 * A007318, read by rows.
link: G. C. Greubel, Rows n = 0..100 of triangle, flattened
formula: T(n,k) = A000012(signed) * A103451 * A007318 as infinite lower triangular matrices, where A000012(signed) = (1; -1,1; 1,-1,1; ...).
T(n,k) = Sum_{j=0..floor((n-1)/2)} binomial(n-2*j-1, k-1), with T(n,0) = 1.- _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 20 2019
example: First few rows of the triangle are:
maple: seq(seq(T(n, k), k=0..n), n=0..12); # _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 20 2019
mathematica: T[n_, k_]:= T[n, k]= If[k==0, 1, Sum[Binomial[n-1-2*j, k-1], {j, 0, Floor[(n-1)/2]}]]; Table[T[n, k], {n,0,12}, {k,0,n}]//Flatten (* _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 20 2019 *)
program: (PARI) T(n,k) = if(k==0, 1, sum(j=0, (n-1)\2, binomial( n-2*j-1, k-1)) ); \\ _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 20 2019
end if; return T; end function;
[T(n,k): k in [0..n], n in [0..12]]; // _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 20 2019
else: return sum(binomial(n-2*j-1, k-1) for j in (0..floor((n-1)/2)))
[[T(n, k) for k in (0..n)] for n in (0..12)] # _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 20 2019
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, Nov 23 2007
ext: Offset changed by _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 20 2019
